trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of cesarean scar thickness during elective repeat cesarean delivery.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Evaluation of cesarean scar thickness during elective repeat cesarean delivery

interventions.interventions: during elective cesarean in women with previous cesarean scar thickness is crudely categorized into 3 groups; thin, medium, and thick. Scar thickness is correlated to number and circumstances of previous cesarean sections.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Cesarean scar thickness is subjectively assessed into thin and transparent (similar to peritoneum), medium fibrous ( similar to sheath), and thick muscular ( similar to adjacent myometrium)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: previous 1-4 cesarean delivery, undergoing repeat cesarean delivery, full-term pregnancy, singleton fetus, cephalic presentation.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Multiple pregnancy, abnormal presentation, placenta previa.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 649 Elhorreya street, Janaklis, Alexandria, Egypt. postcode:03312

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 649 Elhorreya street, Janaklis, Alexandria, Egypt. postcode:03312

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Scar of previous cesarean is assessed intra operatively during repeat CD and thickness is correlated to number and circumstances of previous CD.
